pros: There are many opportunities to get involved in projects and committees to make you a well rounded employee.
cons: Communication and expectations between campuses and departments can sometimes really frustrating. As an instructor, you are a part of various “departments.” You feel like you are “going behind someone’s back” by talking with other departments that you are a part of but your genuinely are trying to get information.

job_title: ESL Instructor/GED Teacher in Vicksburg, MS
pros: Very good work environment and benefits
cons: Low pay and as GED instructor you do not get summers off

pros: They offer flexible schedules to all student workers.
cons: They require a lot of effort and hard work for little pay.

job_title: Front Desk Worker in Raymond, MS
pros: Loved my supervisors. Always super understanding if I needed to request time off. Decent pay for the work - sitting at a desk mostly, answering phone calls for $9/hr. Very very easy work.
cons:
Could not work more than 20 hrs a week period, and pay is okay but not great. 
You have to deal with rude parents who don't understand their kid is a legal adult now and we can't just tell them their academic info without a signed FERPA.

pros: Good benefits, flexible, a lot of paid holidays, vacation and sick time accumulate quickly, you participate in a state retirement plan
cons: The retirement plan takes money out your check before you get paid, high turnover rates, new administration, you how to know people in order to advance

pros: I learned so much during my time. There are so many different ways to gain experience with hands-on training.
cons: Because it's a state institution, your salary was fixed.

pros: Great nursing program to learn
cons: Good classes but really hard

pros: positive environment, great students, very rewarding role
cons: lack of curriculum support in planning

pros: The position feels secure and has good job benefits.
cons: Instructors are micromanaged despite professional position.

pros: Great benefits such as retirement and medical with dental and eye insurance.
cons: Unfair hiring practices. An article in Forbes describes it best. Any company that refuses to share its salary ranges to new prospects for open job positions is using an unfair hiring practice to lure in candidates at the lowest possible salary. While this seems like a good practice for the company, it puts the candidate at an extreme disadvantage. Forbes says that if that is their hiring practice, beware of their management practices as well.

pros: Best job I've ever had. Hands down
cons: The only con I can really think of is sometimes it gets a little too slow for my liking because I don't really like sitting still for long periods of time.

pros: It’s a great place to work .
cons: It’s not that bad of a place to work .

job_title: Instructional Content Developer in Atlanta, GA
pros: Excellent administrators. Great students. Easy going atmosphere.
cons: Low wages. Not many opportunities.

review_title: My experience at the Hinds CC Financial Aid Department was overall a good one.
job_title: Financial Aid Office Assistant/Clerical in Raymond, MS
pros: They were really flexible and understanding when I needed time off. The people were friendly and always willing to help if I had a question. If you just do what they give you and do it well, you'll have a great experience.
cons: The databases could be frustrating at times. There were a couple of days where the entire system crashed, and no one could do their job because we were unable to access the information on the system. The only other con would be that they pay on a monthly basis.

review_title: It's a job, but don't stay too long.
pros: Pretty laid back at times, retirement, time off / comp-time, free classes, paid enrollment for children, and paid insurance. Some of the people are good people and the culture at the College can sometimes be very relaxing. Things don't often move slow, but in IT things do break often. Some of the systems and technology is fairly advanced and on the edge, for the most part. It is still not a bad place to pickup some skills.
cons: It's very hard to get any experience. I had to find experience in another field because I could advance. Promotion is not possible for all but a few and it takes years, if you are lucky enough to have the right seniority. It's not based on skills, I can assure you. Management and the environment is toxic. They don't train, so you have to pickup what you can as they hand off work to you, usually stuff that's tedious but nothing that will add to a real skillset. If you are lucky, like me, someone will let you train under them and you may finally get some recognition. Otherwise, management does't care anything about you or your family, although they may say so to your face. The pay is the worst, for upper level IT it's disrespectful. I left there with a mountain of debt because I had to live off credit cards to pay for medical visits, living expenses, and sometimes food. Hinds is a place where you go to give up and die in your office, filling out useless paperwork or errands that are assigned to you. Don't plan on learning anything or expecting anyone to give you the time of day. If you go on an interview, ask them about "Daily Reports". Also, lookup "Cache memory" (CPU) and "The Language of the internet" (TCP). Those are on the list of all time stupid interview questions that many of them probably couldn't answer without looking it up, so don't feel bad if you miss some questions. It's very impersonal, period, and not just the interviews. You're walking into a graveyard; "Welcome to Hinds". They are currently under review by SACS and they are not in a good place right now.

pros: Great management. Excellent employee perks such as free classes, discounts on AT&T wireless, Dell computers, etc. Staff is very friendly and helpful. They also have a great new employee orientation so you can be fully informed. Just an all-around great place to work.
cons: Monthly paychecks. Pay is a little less than what it should be for professional level jobs. There really isn't anything too negative.

review_title: Excellent........"The best preparation for good work tomorrow is to do good work today"
pros: Being able to network as well as learn about various types of jobs the the enhancement of communication skills.
cons: Only being able to work three days out of a week.

job_title: Instructor, College Or University in Raymond, MS
pros: Great colleagues and student teacher ratio.
cons: Micro managing environment did not foster most productive work atmosphere.
